lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Som.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Som.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Parses user input into executable Command objects.

*

This class analyzes the input string and returns the appropriate
* Command subclass based on the command verb. It validates input format
* and throws SomException for invalid commands.
* Parses a full user command into a Command object.

*

Identifies the command type and returns the corresponding Command
* instance. Throws SomException if the command is invalid.
* @param fullCommand the original user input, must not be null.
* @return the parsed Command object ready for execution.
* @throws SomException if the command is invalid, incomplete or malformed.
public static Command parse(String fullCommand) throws SomException {

* The main chatbot class that handles user interaction, task management, and persistence.

*

This class reads user input, parses commands, manages a list of tasks.
* Creates a new Som Chatbot instance.
* Starts the main interaction loop of the chatbot.

*

Reads user input line by line, processes commands, and responds accordingly.
* The loop continues until the user types {@code bye}.
* All exceptions are caught and displayed in a user-friendly format.
* Custom exception class for user-facing errors in the Som chatbot.

*

Used to wrap and report invalid inputs, file errors, and other
* recoverable issues in a consistent way.
* Constructs a new SomException with the specified message.
* Manages persistent storage of tasks to and from a file on disk.

*

This class handles saving the current task list to a file and loading it back

*

The data file is stored at ./data/som.txt (relative to the project root).
* Corrupted lines in the file are skipped with a warning message.
* All file operations use OS-independent paths via java.nio.file.Paths.
private static final Path FILE_PATH = Paths.get(APP_DIR, FILE_NAME);
* Loads the list of tasks from the data file.

*

If the file does not exist, throws SomException with "File not found!".
* Corrupted lines are skipped, and a warning is printed to the console.
* Requires all tasks to be of a fixed pre-determined input.
* @throws SomException if the file exists but cannot be found during scanning.
public static List<Task> load() throws SomException {

* @param line the raw line from the file to parse.

String[] parts = line.split(" \\| ", -1); // Keep trailing empty strings
Event e = new Event(parts[2], parts[3], parts[4]);
* Saves the current list of tasks to the data file.

*

The file is overwritten completely to reflect the current state of the task list.
* This ensures that deleted or updated tasks are not left in stale form.
* @param tasks the list of tasks to save.
* @throws SomException if an I/O error occurs during writing.
public static void save(List<Task> tasks) throws SomException {

* Finds and displays all tasks that occur with the specified keyword.

*

The user provides a keyword in the format {@code find book}.
* The method parses the input and searches through the task list the keyword.
* Matching tasks are printed in a formatted list. If no tasks are found,
* a friendly message is shown instead.
* @param keyword the item to be looked for.
* @return a List consisting of all matching tasks with the specified date.
* Handles all user interactions with the Som chatbot.

*

This class is responsible for displaying messages, reading user input, and formatting output
* consistently using decorative lines. It encapsulates all console-based I/O, ensuring separation
* of concerns between user interaction and business logic.
* Constructs a new Ui instance with a Scanner for reading user input.
* Displays the welcome message when the app starts.

*

Prints a greeting, a brief description of the app, and an instruction to type "help".
System.out.println(" Hello! I'm Som\n What can I do for you?");
System.out.println(" Type 'help' for a list of commands.");
* Prints a decorative line separator to improve readability.
* Reads a command from the user input.
* @return the trimmed user input, or empty string if input is blank.
* Displays an error message in a formatted way.
* @param exception the error message to display.
* Displays the goodbye message when the user exits.

*

Prints a farewell message and closes the Scanner to release system resources.
System.out.println(" Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");

* Confirms the deletion of a task.

System.out.println(" Now you have " + total + " tasks in the list");
* Confirms the addition of a new Task.

public void showAdd(Task task, int total) {

System.out.println(" Now you have " + total + " tasks in the list");
* Displays all tasks in the current list with their index and status.

*

If the list is empty, a message is shown indicating no tasks exist.
* Each task is printed with its ID (1-based) and string representation.
* @param tasks the list of tasks to display.
System.out.println(" Oops! Your task list is empty!");
* Confirms that a task has been marked as done.
* @param task the task that was marked as done.
System.out.println( " Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n"+ task.toString());
* Confirms that a task has been marked as not done.
* @param task the task that was marked as not done.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + task.toString());

This method prints a help menu that explains the syntax and purpose.
System.out.println("  mark <index>                  Mark task as done");
System.out.println("  unmark <index>                Mark task as not done");
System.out.println("  find <keyword>                Find tasks containing the keyword");
* Represents a command to add a task to the task list.

*

When executed, this command adds the specified task and confirms the addition
* through the user interface. It also triggers an automatic save of the updated list.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the given task.
* @param task the task to be added, must not be null.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws SomException {
* Defines the interface for executable commands in the Som chatbot.

*

This abstract class ensures that all command objects can be executed
* uniformly by the main application loop. Each concrete command must
* implement the execute method to perform its specific action and indicate
* Executes the command using the given TaskList and Ui.

*

This method carries out the command's intended behavior, such as
* adding, marking or deleting tasks. It may modify the task list
* and/or produce results via the Ui. If the command fails, it
* @param tasks the task list on which the command operates.
* @param ui the user interface used to display results or errors.
* @throws SomException if the command fails due to invalid input or state.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws SomException;
* Indicates whether this command should cause the application to exit.
* @return true if executing this command should terminate the app, false otherwise.

When executed, this command adds the specified task and confirms the deletion

* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the given task index.
* @param index the 0-based index of the task to delete.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws SomException {
* Represents a command to exit the application.

*

When executed, this command displays a goodbye message and terminates the app.

*

An event task includes a description, start time, and end time. Both times

* The start time must be before the end time.

* Returns the start date and time of the Event.

* Represents a generic Task in the task list.

*

This abstract class serves as the base for all specific task types, such as
* Todo, Deadline and Event. It contains common properties such as description
* and completion status. Subclasses must implement the toString() and encode()
* methods to define their string representation and format.
* Constructs a new Task with the given description.
* @param description the task description, must not be null.
* Returns the status icon: "X" if done, " " otherwise.
* @return "X" if the task is done, " " if the task is not done.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Marks the task as not done.
* Encodes a task the specified format for saving.
* @return the formatted representation of the task to be saved.
* Returns string representation of the task.
* Represents a todo task with no time constraints.

*

A todo is the simplest type of task, containing only a description
* and completion status. It does not have a due date or time.
* Encodes a task into a line like: T | 1 | read book.
* @return the formatted representation of the task to be saved.
* Returns string representation of the Todo task.
